metadata.title: CVE-2022-31151 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description: Authorization headers are cleared on cross-origin redirect. However, cookieheaders which are sensitive headers and are official headers found in thespec, remain uncleared. There are active users using cookie headers inundici. This may lead to accidental leakage of cookie to a 3rd-party siteor a malicious attacker who can control the redirection target (ie. an openredirector) to leak the cookie to the 3rd party site. This was patched inv5.7.1. By default, this vulnerability is not exploitable. Do not enableredirections, i.e. `maxRedirections: 0` (the default).

criterions.comment: node-undici package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
node-undici package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
